item.title: Offshore Scuba Diving
item.dc:creator: Jorge Gallegos
item.description: Explore pristine reefs and encounter breathtaking marine life, from schooling tuna and sea turtles to humpback whales with their calves, reef sharks, and giant manta rays. Even the tiniest seahorses hide among the vibrant reefs.
item.content:encoded:
The stuff scuba dreams are made up…

These offshore dive sites offer both virgin reefs and pelagic big life encounters worthy of Nat Geo documentary footage; Schooling Tuna flying past, reefs swarming with sea turtles, Humpback whale mothers introducing their calves to the world, reef sharks resting within the volcanic nooks, giant manta rays visiting the reefs’ cleaning stations to be service by the most intricately colored tropical fish, even the tiniest most delicate sea horse as they hold the reef into which they seem to the untrained eye to disappear.

Our certified and experienced PADI dive staff will lead you through the dive experience of a lifetime and assure that not a single encounter goes missed. Travel out of the protected bay and into the open ocean in style and comfort aboard our custom dive fleet.

Top Dive Sites:

  • El Morro: Towering pinnacles rising from depths of over 100 feet, home to incredible marine life.
  • La Corbeteña: Two seamounts where the reef meets the open ocean, attracting pelagic giants.
  • El Banco: Three deep seamounts offering uninterrupted pelagic encounters.
  • Tres Marías Islands: A pristine island chain with untouched reefs, a glimpse into the underwater world as it once was.

Book your offshore diving adventure today!

-Departure time from Marina la Cruz and Punta Mita: 09:00 am.

Boats available:

  • Spearo 2, 30 ft power catamaran, center console
  • Spearo 5, 35 ft, with cabin, bathroom and tuna tower
  • Sport fishing yacht 45 ft, with cabin, bathroom, and flybridge.

Features

  • 2 Tanks
  • 6 hours experience
  • Drinks; bottled water, electrolytes and sodas.
  • Snacks, fruit and banana bread.
  • Safety gear on every boat (life jackets and marine first aid kit)
  • Specially trained, bilingual and experienced Captain and Deckhands

item.title: Advanced Open Water Diver Certification
item.dc:creator: Jorge Gallegos
item.description: This course can be taken after completing the PADI Open Water Diver certification. It's titled PADI Advanced Open Water Diver because it advances your diving knowledge &amp; skills.
item.content:encoded:
This course can be taken after completing the PADI Open Water Diver certification. It’s titled PADI Advanced Open Water Diver because it advances your diving knowledge & skills.

That’s what the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course is all about. You don’t have to be “advanced” to take it – it’s designed to advance your diving, so you can start right after earning your PADI Open Water Diver certification. The course helps build confidence and expand your scuba skills through different Adventure Dives. You try out different specialties while gaining experience under the supervision of your PADI Instructor. You log dives and develop capabilities as you find new ways to have fun scuba diving.

Academic

You’ll plan your learning path with your instructor by choosing from a long list of Adventure Dives. There are two required dives – Deep and Underwater Navigation – and you choose the other three, for a total of five dives.
During the Deep Adventure Dive, you learn how to plan dives to deal with the physiological effects and challenges of deeper scuba diving. The Underwater Navigation Adventure Dive refines your compass navigation skills and helps you better navigate using kick-cycles, visual landmarks and time.

The other knowledge and skills you get vary with your interest and the adventures you have – photography, buoyancy control, fish identification, exploring wrecks and many more.

item.title: Open Water Diver Certification
item.dc:creator: Jorge Gallegos
item.description: Diver certification begins here. Start with PADI's online eLearning course. Move to the pool and practice your new skills. Then experience four open water (ocean/lake) dives.
item.content:encoded:
Diver certification begins here. Start with PADI’s online eLearning course. Move to the pool and practice your new skills. Then experience four open water (ocean/lake) dives.

If you’ve always wanted to take scuba diving lessons, experience unparalleled adventure and see the world beneath the waves, this is where it starts. Get your scuba diving certification with the PADI® Open Water Diver course – the world’s most popular and widely recognized scuba course. Millions of people have learned to scuba dive and gone on to discover the wonders of the aquatic world through this course. To enroll in a PADI Open Water Diver course (or Junior Open Water Diver course), you must be 10 years old or older. You need adequate swimming skills and need to be in good physical health. No prior experience with scuba diving is required.

Academic

The PADI Open Water Diver course consists of three main phases:

  • Knowledge Development ( online, independent study or in a classroom) to understand basic principles of scuba diving
  • Confined Water Dives to learn basic scuba skills
  • Open Water Dives to use your skills and explore!

item.title: Discover Scuba Diving
item.dc:creator: Jorge Gallegos
item.description:
Discover Scuba Diving with SPEARMEX in Punta de Mita, Nayarit! Are you ready to explore the underwater.
  • 24 Feet power boat (Spearo 12)
  • 3 hours
  • Price per person (min 2 people)
item.content:encoded:
Are you ready to explore the underwater world but not quite ready to commit to a full certification course? The PADI Discover Scuba Diving experience is the perfect introduction!

Join us in the breathtaking waters of Punta de Mita, where clear visibility, vibrant marine life, and expert instructors come together to create an unforgettable adventure. In just one day, you’ll learn the basics of scuba diving, including essential safety rules and techniques, before taking your first breath underwater in the calm, shallow waters of this tropical paradise.
No prior experience is needed—just your sense of adventure! Whether you’re visiting for a family vacation, a romantic getaway, or a solo exploration, this experience is designed to make your first dive fun, safe, and memorable.

Departure times from Marina la Cruz and Punta Mita: 09:00 am and 02:00 pm.

Features

  • 3 hours experience
  • Drinks; bottled water, electrolytes and sodas.
  •  Snacks, fruit and banana bread.
  • Safety gear on every boat (life jackets and marine first aid kit)
  • Specially trained, bilingual and experienced Captain and Deckhands
